title: Representing SHM - equation for new block

content.question: A block of mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> is attached to a horizontal spring with spring constant <math alttext="k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi></math>. The block is displaced from equilibrium and released from rest, undergoing simple harmonic motion along the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-axis. The position of the block as a function of time is described by <math alttext="x equals, open parenthesis, 0.20 meters, close parenthesis, times the cosine of, open bracket, the fraction lowercase t over, open parenthesis, 2 seconds, close parenthesis, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.20</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mo>[</mo><mfrac><mi>t</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>]</mo></mrow></math>. The block is removed and a new block with mass <math alttext="16 m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>16</mn><mi>m</mi></math> is attached to the same spring and set into simple harmonic motion with an amplitude of <math alttext="0.60 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.60</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>. Which of the following equations could describe the motion of the new block?

choices.label: <math alttext="x equals, open parenthesis, 0.60 meters, close parenthesis, times the cosine of, open bracket, the fraction lowercase t over 6 seconds, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mn>0.60</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mi>cos</mi><mpadded><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mo>[</mo><mpadded><mfrac><mi>t</mi><mrow><mn>6</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></mrow></mfrac></mpadded><mo>]</mo></mpadded></math>

<math alttext="x equals, open parenthesis, 0.60 meters, close parenthesis, times the cosine of, open bracket, the fraction lowercase t over 8 seconds, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mn>0.60</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mi>cos</mi><mpadded><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mo>[</mo><mpadded><mfrac><mi>t</mi><mrow><mn>8</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></mrow></mfrac></mpadded><mo>]</mo></mpadded></math>

<math alttext="x equals, open parenthesis, 0.60 meters, close parenthesis, times the cosine of, open bracket, the fraction lowercase t over 24 seconds, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mn>0.60</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mi>cos</mi><mpadded><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mo>[</mo><mpadded><mfrac><mi>t</mi><mrow><mn>24</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></mrow></mfrac></mpadded><mo>]</mo></mpadded></math>

<math alttext="x equals, open parenthesis, 0.60 meters, close parenthesis, times the cosine of, open bracket, the fraction lowercase t over 32 seconds, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mn>0.60</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mi>cos</mi><mpadded><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mo>[</mo><mpadded><mfrac><mi>t</mi><mrow><mn>32</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></mrow></mfrac></mpadded><mo>]</mo></mpadded></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="x equals, open parenthesis, 0.60 meters, close parenthesis, times the cosine of, open bracket, the fraction lowercase t over 8 seconds, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mn>0.60</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mi>cos</mi><mpadded><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mo>[</mo><mpadded><mfrac><mi>t</mi><mrow><mn>8</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></mrow></mfrac></mpadded><mo>]</mo></mpadded></math>

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
